title.narrative: OUTPUT 2: POLICY TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

description.narrative: By 2022, provincial and territory governments and other stakeholders have new evidence to inform policy options to address child labour, violence and exploitation, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, 65 % of girls and boys under-5 are registered in Pakistan, with universal birth registration achieved and embedded within civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) systems in two provinces, children access appropriate child protection preventive and/or response services, primarily through public case management and referral system in at least two provinces, and communities practice positive behaviours contributing towards a protective environment for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, provincial and territory governments and other stakeholders have new evidence to inform policy options to address childlabour, violence and exploitation

description.narrative: Strategic advocacy for the nation-wide CLS initiated in 2019 contributed to US$3.6 million allocation by the provinces government to undertake the survey. Two provinces/regions completed the survey: GB disseminated the CLS report, while the Punjab report was finalized. The remaining provinces/regions are currently at start-up phases. For evidence-based policymaking based on these funding, UNICEF signed an MoU with ILO to to support policy formulation for addressing child labour, and is supporting establishment of a national advisory structure. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2022

title.narrative: No. of policies on violence or exploitation, aligned with applicable international minimum standards, available/endorsed(59346)

baseline.value: 0 No VAC policies; No Child Labour policies

target.value: 2022:Approved policy on economic exploitation for Balochistan, PAK, ICT. Approved policy on VAC for Balochistan. Sindh. KP, Punjab, GB

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF-ILO MoU signed for providing technical assistance on policy formulation on economic exploitation; work on policy tools begun. Child protection policy including child safeguarding and data protection and confidentiality drafted for all provinces and

title.narrative: Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex, Text

baseline.value: 1996 Child Labour Survey; Study on online sexual exploitation of children; No Provincial Child Labour Surveys No VAC studies Baseline: 0

target.value: 2022:CLS completed in Sindh, KP, Balochistan, ICT and PAK

actual.value: 2021:CLS completed in Punjab, GB. In KP, ToT completed, Sindh, listing completed, ICT pretesting of tools completed, PAK and Balochistan constrained due to delays in MICS
